title: Ticket #5890: Clarify manual regarding VARS within splices
description:
Lauren just told me that, from her reading of the DAGMan manual, she thought that VARS within splices are not allowed.

(See the "Limitation: Splices and the RETRY of a Node, use of VARS, or use of PRIORITY" section.) Looking at the wording of that section, I can see why it might be kind of confusing...

Note that a bunch of the examples above have splices that have VARS, but Lauren thought that examples of what works and what doesn't, in the relevant section, would be useful.

I think part of the problem is that there are a couple of things that are getting combined:

  • You cannot have VARS or RETRY on a splice itself.
  • What happens if you try to specify VARS or RETRY, from outside the splice, on a node within a splice.

(Also note that some of this may be affected by the "all_nodes" implementation -- see #5729.)
check_ins: 2016-Sep-22 12:50   Check-in [49263]: Gittrac #5890: Clarified the wording in the manual about VARS applied to nodes within splices; also clarified a bunch of other stuff in the DAGMan section, mostly related to sub-DAGs and splices. (By Kent Wenger )
